thread.title: Tilda Swinton, Isabel Marant, The Fat Jewish - Style.com News
thread.title_full: Tilda Swinton, Isabel Marant, The Fat Jewish - Style.com News

author: Lorenzo McClellan
title: Tilda Swinton, Isabel Marant, The Fat Jewish - Style.com News
text:
Photo: Billy Farrell / BFAnyc.com
Tilda’s muses…
The infinitely versatile Tilda Swinton went through one of her biggest transformations yet to become Dianna, the cynical magazine editor in Trainwreck . How did she pull off such a metamorphosis? It turns out two fashion icons inspired her. Said Swinton: “[Dianna’s] the woman who’s trying to look like somebody who’s the editor of French Vogue —and failing. And she dresses in Victoria Beckham.” [ Hollywood Reporter ]
Chanel crosses the channel…
London’s Saatchi Gallery is famous for supporting young and unknown artists, but this October the space will celebrate quite a recognizable name with a three-floor exhibition. Mademoiselle Privé will cover the entire history of Chanel, from Coco to Karl, haute couture to perfume. [ The Telegraph ]
Isabel Marant illustrates her life…
If a picture is worth a thousand words, Isabel Marant has just given a 15,000-word interview. See her charming illustrated answers to questions such as “Which cartoon character do you relate to?” and “What is your secret vice?” [ T Magazine ]
Karolina Kurkova, Bar Refaeli, The Fat Jewish…
Josh Ostrovsky, aka The Fat Jewish, is the latest Internet personality to be signed by One Management. “I knew that having a mediocre body would one day become the new having a great body,” said the Instagram phenomenon. [ Racked ]
More proof that L.A. is happening…
The fashion crowd is flocking to L.A. these days, and now a big force in the industry is following suit: WWD will be available on LAtimes.com , and print editions will be delivered to selected subscribers. [ WWD ].
The new face of Vivienne Westwood…
…is Gwendoline Christie. The designer and the actress bonded at the former’s Fall 2015 runway show, so Westwood invited Christie back for more. The images are as wild as you would expect a Westwood-Juergen Teller collaboration to be. [ Vivienne Westwood ]
